de.embl.rieslab.emu.micromanager.mmproperties

Class MMProperty<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.embl.rieslab.emu.micromanager.mmproperties.MMProperty<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the Micro-manager property.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfigurableMainFrameTest.TestableMMProperty, ConfigurablePanelTest.TestableMMProperty, FloatMMProperty, IntegerMMProperty, PresetGroupAsMMProperty, StringMMProperty

    public abstract class MMProperty<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract wrapper for a Micro-manager device property. This class allows retrieving and modifying the value of a device property, within its limits, or allowed values, as defined by Micro-manager. Each MMProperty is identified by a hash "deviceLabel-propertyLabel" where deviceLabel is the label of the device holding the property and propertyLabel is the label of the property.
    Author:
    Joran Deschamps

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public T getValue()
        Returns the current value of the device property. This method calls Micro-Manager CMMCore.
        Returns:
        Current value.

      • getStringValue

        public java.lang.String getStringValue()
        Returns the current value of the device property as a String. This method calls Micro-Manager CMMCore.
        Returns:
        Current String value.

      • setValue

        public boolean setValue(java.lang.String stringval,
                        UIProperty source)
        Sets the value of the device property and updates all parent UIProperties. This method is called by a parent UIProperty, and the source is excluded from the notification (using notifyListeners(UIProperty, String)). The method calls Micro-Manager CMMCore.
        Parameters:
        stringval - New value.
        source - UIProperty at the origin of the update.
        Returns:
        True if the value was set, false otherwise.

      • hasLimits

        public boolean hasLimits()
        Checks if the MMProperty has limits.
        Returns:
        True if the device property has limits, false otherwise.

      • hasAllowedValues

        public boolean hasAllowedValues()
        Checks if the Micro-manager property has allowed values.
        Returns:
        True if the device property has allowed values, false otherwise.

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Checks if the Micro-manager property is read-only.
        Returns:
        True if the device property is read only, false otherwise.

      • getAllowedValues

        public T[] getAllowedValues()
        Returns the array of allowed values. This array can be null if the MMProperty has no allowed value.
        Returns:
        Allowed values, null if it has none.

      • getStringAllowedValues

        public java.lang.String[] getStringAllowedValues()
        Returns the array of allowed values as Strings. In particular, the array is of size 0 if it has no allowed value.
        Returns:
        Allowed values as Strings, array of size 0 if it has none.

      • getStringMax

        public java.lang.String getStringMax()
        Returns the maximum value as a String. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Maximum value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getStringMin

        public java.lang.String getStringMin()
        Returns the minimum value has a String. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Minimum value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getMax

        public T getMax()
        Returns the maximum value. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Maximum value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getMin

        public T getMin()
        Returns the minimum value. If the device property doesn't have limits, then the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Minimum value, or null if the device property doesn't have limits.

      • getDeviceLabel

        public java.lang.String getDeviceLabel()
        Returns the parent device label.
        Returns:
        Device label.

      • getMMPropertyLabel

        public java.lang.String getMMPropertyLabel()
        Returns the device property label.
        Returns:
        Property label.

      • getHash

        public java.lang.String getHash()
        Returns the MMProperty hash, which is "{device label}-{property label}" (without brackets).
        Returns:
        Property's hash

      • addListener

        public void addListener(UIProperty listener)
        Adds a UIProperty listener to the list of listeners. The UIProperty is then notified when the value of the MMProperty is changed.
        Parameters:
        listener - Parent UIProperty

      • clearAllListeners

        public void clearAllListeners()
        Clear all listeners from the property. Used upon reloading the UI or changing the configuration.

      • updateMMProperty

        public void updateMMProperty()
        Updates all listeners with the current MMProperty value.

      • isStringAllowed

        public boolean isStringAllowed(java.lang.String val)
        Checks if the String val is allowed.
        Parameters:
        val - String to check
        Returns:
        True if val is allowed, false otherwise.

      • getType

        public MMProperty.MMPropertyType getType()
        Returns the property type, "Float", "Integer", "String", "Undef" or "Config".
        Returns:
        property type.
